lexUnit.name: brand.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: mark out as having a particular shameful quality:

sentence.text: A betrayal which had secured their dismissal from Mr Ben Braithwaite himself who had branded them as troublemakers with no hope of employment anywhere in Frizingley again .
The intention had been to brand her as a ` hoarder " as well as the ` milk snatcher " , but most of us thought this seemed an eminently sensible thing for her to have done .
CHELSEA legend Ron Harris last night branded Vinny Jones a coward and told him : ` The hard men of yesteryear would have eaten you for breakfast ! "
POMPEY boss Jim Smith branded striker Paul Walsh ` stupid " after he was sent off in their ill-tempered Anglo-Italian Cup tie victory at Fratton Park last night .
Meanwhile , Mr Major 's handling of the whole Maastricht issue was branded a total shambles last night .
The astonishing attack came as enraged creditors branded the disgraced coach chief ` scum , " a ` cheat " and a ` fraud . "
SUNDAY trading laws were branded a “ farce ” yesterday by Darlington councillor Bill Dixon .
He was also branded a nosy parker by some of his Abingdon neighbours .
Pits protesters are branded ` spoilt children "
PLANNED cuts in overseas aid were branded ` repugnant " by Mr Smith , who accused the Government of making the starving pay for their economic blunders .
THE most important revolution in education for decades was branded a flop by school inspectors yesterday .

Other internal Scottish Region expresses to Aberdeen and Inverness also became part of the Provincial empire , even though their carriages were still branded ` InterCity " for many years after sectorisation .
MIKE Small was branded ` stupid " by furious boss Billy Bonds after being sent off for swearing at a linesman at Oakwell yesterday .
FURIOUS homebuyers are set to sue the builder of their luxury estate after paying £100,000 for houses branded no better than SANDCASTLES .
The vehicle owners ' pressure group Stichting Weg has branded the plans ` impractical , unreasonable and inequitable " .
THE terse official report into the cause of the Windsor Castle fire was branded an inadequate whitewash by MPs last night .
BRITAIN 'S crowded classrooms have been branded a ` public disgrace " by the ex-head of the National Curriculum Council .
The conservative journal American Spectator has even branded her ` the Winnie Mandela of American politics " .
Tassi was jailed but by then the slander of Artemesia 's name was complete : she was branded a whore , later married off to a stranger and banished from Rome .
THE EC is today expected to announce the release of funds to repair a North Wales road bridge branded a potential death trap for children .
DOUBLE beds were branded passion killers by lovers yesterday .
